intro: Sempervivum canariense subsp. latifolium, commonly known as the Canary Island houseleek, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features rosettes of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically green with a bluish or reddish tinge. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky, sunny environments and requires minimal water. Its compact size and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
